message.content:
<<<api>>>: InputStream.read
<<<code>>>: URL url = new URL("http://example.com/playlist.pls");
URLConnection conn = url.openConnection();
InputStream is = conn.getInputStream();
BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader(new InputStreamReader(is));
String line;
while ((line = br.readLine()) != null) {
    if (line.startsWith("File")) {
        String[] parts = line.split("=");
        String streamUrl = parts[1];
        // do something with the streamUrl
        break;
    }
}
br.close();
is.close();
<<<explanation>>>: To stream a radio from a .pls file, you can download the .pls file and then read its contents line by line. Look for the line that starts with "File" and extract the URL after the "=" sign. You can then use this URL to stream the radio. In the code above, we use the InputStream.read API to read the contents of the .pls file and BufferedReader to read the lines. Once we find the line starting with "File", we split it by "=" and extract the URL.
